title: Shares of several financial services companies are trading lower as equities sell off following recent rally. Stocks have rallied over the past week amid optimism towards the US economy reopening and investors have potentially taken some profits following run up.

Shares of several financial services companies are trading higher following strong US jobs data and continued optimism amid the reopening of the economy.
Shares of several financial services companies are trading higher as equities continue to gain on optimism over an economic reopening as well as a smaller-than-expected drop in nonfarm payrolls.

Shares of several global financial services companies are trading higher, potentially in sympathy with US market strength. US equities have gained this session on investor hopes of a pickup in economic activity, which could lead to a rebound in spending and borrowing.
